title: Lamp Thookkuvilakku
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00230

  Image: 

  object_work_type: hanging lamps bronzes (visual works) oil lamps

  title_text: Lamp Thookkuvilakku

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: 1900 - 1999

  creation_place_original_location: Kerala (India)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: bell metal

  techniques_name: metalworking

  object_colour: bronze

  physical_appearance: The image shows a lamp. It has the colour of bronze. It comes with a chain that is attached to a closed ring at the top of the lamp. The base of the lamp is wider than its middle and top. Also
 the base is shaped like a plate
 while the middle part is designed like the shape of a gear
 with cut teeth.

  subject_terms_1: cultural artifacts ritual objects Hinduism religious objects

  subject_terms_2: Lamps Hindu temples Religious articles

  subject_terms_3: Temples Hinduism

  sgcool_label_text: This hanging oil lamp or thookkuvilakku is a typical Kerala design
 frequently seen at temples in the region. Made of bell metal
 the lamp would be lit by multiple wicks and suspended from a low beam or rafter
 to make it easy to light.

metadata.object_work_type: hanging lamps bronzes (visual works) oil lamps
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a lamp. It has the colour of bronze. It comes with a chain that is attached to a closed ring at the top of the lamp. The base of the lamp is wider than its middle and top. Also, the base is shaped like a plate, while the middle part is designed like the shape of a gear, with cut teeth.
metadata.subject_terms_1: cultural artifacts ritual objects Hinduism religious objects
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This hanging oil lamp or thookkuvilakku is a typical Kerala design, frequently seen at temples in the region. Made of bell metal, the lamp would be lit by multiple wicks and suspended from a low beam or rafter, to make it easy to light.
